name: SPLITTER
tagline: for high divergent genomes in RADseq datasets
body:
### About

SPLITTER is a pipeline written in Python to calculate the degree of genomic divergence between individuals of the same dataset. This can be particularly useful when working with species with unresolved or poorly taxonomic status.

Here you can find the source code, example data for training and user's manual. ### Support & Help Authors provide Support through the discussion forum ([SPLITTER-Support](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/splitter-support)). Please report any doubt or problem related with SPLITTER. ### Authors Ricardo Arraiano-Castilho1, Michael R. Miller2, Albano Beja-Pereira1,3

1. CIBIO/InBIO, Research center in Biodiversity and Genetic resources, University of Porto, Campus Agrário de Vairão, 4485–661 Vairão, Portugal

2. Department of Animal Science, University of California, One Shields Avenue, Davis, CA 95616, USA

3. Dept of Biology, Faculty of Sciences, University of Porto, R. Campo Alegre S/N, 4000 Porto, Portugal

### Citation The present work was submitted to Bioinformatics journal in 2014 (submitted)
